channel.title: BDI Code Club
channel.description: Recent content on BDI Code Club

item.title: Version control with Git and RStudio
item.description: Some Background Why Git? What is Git? The general Git workflow What’s the difference Git and GitHub? Getting Started with Git, GitHub, and RStudio Installing Git Creating a GitHub account Starting a new project with Git Beginning from RStudio Beginning from GitHub Other Helpful Resource R-centered links Happy Git and GitHub for the useR from Jenny Bryan and Jim Hester is a great place to continue from here, with a focus on R, RStudio, and GitHub.

item.title: Utilizing the maximum computation power of your computer on R
item.description: Note Please open your R-Studio as an administrator. Overview In this tutorial, we introduce a package to use multiple cores of your system. After this tutorial you will be able to: Train a neural network model without using multicores Train a neural network model without using multicores Compare results Using R Markdown The tutorial that follows was created using R Markdown. As an exercise in using R Markdown, here, we ask you to save your work in an R Markdown file.

item.title: BDI Code Clinic
item.description: The Big Data Institute (BDI) is an interdisciplinary research institute that focuses on the analysis of large, complex, heterogeneous data sets for research into the causes and consequences, prevention and treatment of disease. Our coding club’s ambition is to create a fun and supportive environment where we develop programming and statistics skills together, across programming languages. We have a many experts in working with Python, R, C++ and many more languages with vast knowledge of cloud computing and HPC and we want to replace statistics anxiety and code fear with inspiration and motivation to learn.
